title: Senior Account Manager - Commercial - Remote
description:
**\\*\\*\\*****This is a Remote opportunity, for Florida Residents only, based out of our Longwood, FL Office.****\\*\\*\\*** **Title:** **Senior Account Manager**  

Welcome to **Insurance Office of America** – one of the nation’s largest and premier privately held insurance agencies! Recognized as a *Top Workplaces USA* Award winner, IOA’s commitment to both a rewarding culture and employee satisfaction is unwavering. Prioritizing a strong work/life balance, personal and professional growth, competitive benefits, and giving back to our community aren’t just clichés here – they’re a part of who we are. With a growing workforce and over 60 office locations across the US and Northern Ireland, we can confidently serve our clients with an unmatched standard of excellence.  

Want to learn more? Complete the application below and one of our talented recruiters will be ready to answer any other questions you may have. **Job Summary**  

Working in conjunction with Account Executive (AE) or Producer and following established industry and company guidelines; responsible for managing an assigned book of business; increasing account retention and new business support; and meeting all performance requirements regarding production, quality, and ensuring that no liability associated with errors and omissions occur. Responsible for strategic coordination and execution of day- to-day administrative and customer service activities for assigned accounts, and capable of resolving complex customer service problems, showing the ability for critical thinking and thought process in taking the next step in the best interest of the client, carrier partner and IOA. Serving as a subject matter expert for administrative, customer service and account management team key duties and responsibilities.

 **What You’ll Do:**  

* Maintain high degree of technical competence and industry/market expertise
* Exercise discretion and independent judgment to ensure beneficial outcomes for clients and IOA
* Serve as Account Manager Subject Matter Expert answering questions, providing support, and developing solutions to client problems for account team
* Assist in directing day-to-day activities and workflow assigned to administrative, customer service and account management team that are performed on assigned book of business, which include delegation and prioritization of assignment/task, communication on performance expectations, and monitoring execution to ensure performance requirements and timelines are met
* Management and execution of a variety of customer service and value-added service requests/inquiries including but not limited to: account activity; policy administration and insurance placement; billing activity; claims administration; coverage/loss analysis; contract review for insurability; review policy forms and endorsements; review audits; identify errors and facilitate corrective actions; Certificates of Insurance; Evidences of Property; and Cancellation/Reinstatements
* Manage policy expirations for existing clients and work proactively to ensure appropriate actions are taken to facilitate renewals and ensure all new and renewal insurance policies are bound, billed and issued accurately and delivered to the Client/Insured within required timeframe
* Manage new business and policy renewal process in conjunction with AE and/or Producer including but not limited to:
	+ Conducting client research and gathering complete underwriting information
	+ Conducting Loss Run Analysis
	+ Preparing complete and accurate submissions including Acord applications and/or supplemental forms; sending out to market and/or performing Online Rating as required
	+ Evaluating and negotiating coverages and pricing
	+ Preparing and presenting Proposals
	+ Binding coverage and complying with any subjectivity(ies) as required by carrier, Surplus Lines Association and/or IOA
	+ Preparing and executing Premium Finance Agreements, when applicable
	+ Diligent follow up for Policy Issuance
	+ Review all policies, identifying and notifying AE or Producer of any discrepancies and ensuring that all necessary changes are submitted to and issued by the carrier
	+ Maintaining accurate and complete policy transaction detail, schedules and Summaries of Insurance
* Monitor Accounts Receivables reports and take action on any delinquent accounts along with collecting outstanding balances due
* Maintain agency management system, other agency supported systems and carrier/vendor online platforms, ensuring all data entered is complete, clearly presented and well-documented, accurate, and up-to-date
* Monitor and maintain activity/suspense, taking necessary action to ensure completion within required time frame
* Maintain frequent, transparent communication with account team regarding individual and team client service and policy administration activities, ensuring that the AE or Producer is fully informed of workload status, questions, concerns and/or any errors, discrepancies or changes as it relates to the account and their insurance policies and facilitates appropriate/corrective actions
* Deliver excellent service at all times, including proactively anticipating needs, maintaining frequent and professional communication, and responding quickly to service requests
* Continually stay abreast of all company policies and procedures to ensure good knowledge, execution and compliance of standard operating procedures
* Continually seek to improve individual and team performance, including identifying, communicating and adopting best practices
* Live and champion IOA core values at all times, demonstrating the highest level of personal character, integrity, and servant leadership
* Regular and consistent attendance is expected and a necessary component to the job
* Perform other duties as assigned

 **What We’re Looking For:**  

 5+ years of account management experience; or 7+ years related experience in the insurance industry
 Has a very good working knowledge of insurance brokerage business and all clients’ needs
 All required active licensing
 At least one professional designation preferred, such as CIC or equivalent
 Strong analytical, problem solving and decision making skills
 Exceptional customer service skills
 Excellent multi-tasking, organizational, and prioritization skills
 Outstanding verbal/written communication skills
 Ability to perform large work volumes with high degrees of accuracy and attention to detail
 PC proficiency, including basic knowledge of MS Office products, including Outlook, Word and Excel
 Exceptional personal character
 High School Diploma (or equivalent) **What We Offer**:  

* Competitive salaries and bonus earning potential
* Great benefits, including company paid health insurance
* Paid time off for holidays, vacations, and sick time
* 401K with an employer match
* Participation in our employee stock plan
* Opportunities for professional growth and career progression
* A culture that emphasizes respect for every individual
* Company commitment to work/family life balance and community service
* Teammates who share your drive for excellence
* Knowing every day you are helping our clients protect their families and businesses

 **Still wondering if IOA is the right fit for you?**  

* If you want to feel the significance of knowing your efforts have been both recognized, appreciated and rewarded, *then IOA is right for you*.
* If you want to feel valued and have a real influence towards the continued success of your organization, *then IOA is right for you*.
* If you want to feel the peace of knowing that you’ve made the best decision of your professional life, *then IOA is right for you*.

title: Regional Sales Manager - Remote - (Southern Region)
description:
*For over a century, Wilbur-Ellis has experienced success and growth in marketing and distributing agricultural products and services. Join us and grow your career with a strong and profitable industry leader offering competitive compensation, tremendous growth and development opportunities, and a people-first work environment. Come grow with us!*


**General Purpose and Scope of Position:**



The Regional Sales Manager (RSM) is responsible for growing the business within their designated region. The RSM is responsible for the management and development of all sales and marketing activities within the assigned region. Assurance of alignment with corporate goals and initiatives is critical. The RSM will effectively manage their region where sales budgets, cost centers, and forecasts are well planned and completed on time.


**Key Skills and Abilities Include:**


* Bachelor’s degree
* Minimum of 10 years of sales leadership experience
* Previous experience managing budgets and sales forecasts
* Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook


**Key Personal Attributes Include:**


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong attention to detail and highly organized


**Specific Responsibilities and Key Deliverables Include:**


* Responsible for developing, overseeing, and executing accurate sales and expense budgets
* Develop and oversee the execution of the sales and marketing plan
* Responsible for growing the sales volume in the region
* Manage and coordinate the sales efforts of the various sales positions in the region
* Lead and motivate direct reports to achieve and exceed sales budgets
* Participate in annual strategic planning and budgeting process
* Responsible for the operation of terminals within the region, including inventory management
* Responsible for training and personal development of all direct reports
* Manage accounts receivable as required to keep receivables current


**Compensation and Benefits:**


* In compliance with all states and cities requiring transparency of pay, the base compensation for this position ranges from $116,000 to $163,000. Note that salary may vary based on location, skills, and experience. This position is eligible for commission, vacation, holidays, health, dental, vision, mental health, retirement plans, and other benefits. Follow this link for other information regarding Wilbur-Ellis employee benefits https://bit.ly/3S8aDCj
* Drug-Free Workplace

  




**NACHURS** is a Wilbur-Ellis business.



For over 75 years, **NACHURS®** has been the industry leader in **NPK LIQUID FERTILIZER TECHNOLOGY.** Built on quality, integrity, and innovation, we pioneered precision-placed liquid fertilizer in 1946 – formulated to meet the nutritional demands of crops and growing conditions on both sides of the border. Our liquid fertilizers are marketed under the ALPINE brand and NACHURS brands in North America. The New Ag Markets Business Unit sells liquid fertilizer into turf, specialty, international, and private label markets. Products sold into oil and gas markets, transportation and mining markets and industrial chemical markets are all sold under the NASi brand. Nachurs Alpine Solutions has manufacturing plants located in Garretson, SD, Marion, OH, Corydon, IN, Red Oak, IA, St. Gabriel, LA, New Hamburg, ON and Belle Plaine, SK.


**COMPANY CULTURE**

***Wilbur-Ellis is a company you can be proud to call your employer***



Wilbur-Ellis markets and distributes agricultural products, animal feed specialty chemicals, and food ingredients. A privately held and consistently profitable company, we employ more than 4,000 people throughout North America and Asia-Pacific.


***Wilbur-Ellis is for and about people***



Wilbur-Ellis has enjoyed over 100 years of success and growth, all thanks to our people. Our employees are both leaders and team players who thrive on creativity, entrepreneurial spirit, and a dedication to quality work, our customers, and each other.


***Wilbur-Ellis invests in the industry’s best workforce***



Wilbur-Ellis invests heavily in our employees by offering skill development and training, competitive compensation and benefits, and a tradition of promoting from within for a broad range of career opportunities. And we foster a supportive, people-first work environment.


### ***Follow our career social media accounts!***

  



**Instagram:** **Twitter:** **TikTok:** **Facebook:**

**LinkedIn:**

description:

title: Regional Manager, Retail Sales
description:
Who We Are



At C.A. Carlin, we take brands to new heights. We are one of the leading privately held sales agencies in the industry. Thanks to nimble growth and associations with our operating partners, C.A. Fortune and C.A. Ferolie, we have built brand value that is unlike any other in the CPG industry.

  



What We Do



Since our start in 1962, we have built industry relationships on the foundation of trust and action. We turn information into insight. We convert insight into programs. We drive programs that consistently deliver results to our clients, on their timeline.



We have more than 300 associates and multiple offices throughout the country. We represent top brands in many categories such as confection, snack, grocery, beverage, frozen, dairy etc.

  



Overview of the Role


* Responsible for managing a retail team within a defined, market territory
* Directly manage and train Retail Representatives
* Interact with Director for selection, prioritization and execution of retail services
* Execute consistent retail practices including use of retail software
* Location: Remote - Los Angeles, CA
* Salary Range: $50,000 - 60,000 annually
* At C.A. we're not looking for perfection, just people that want to commit to a us and grow their careers long-term. We are on a mission to build better brands that inspire healthier lifestyles for consumers and their families. If you're looking for a sign to apply, here it is!

  



What You'll Do at C.A. Carlin


* Manage, support, hire and train Retail Representatives
* Retail software Mission execution including data entry verification and completion score carding
* Consistent and quality photo compilation to align with proper task, mission.
* Maintain comprehensive and accurate store listings
* Delegation of store assignment, routes and frequency to individual Retail Representatives
* Identify opportunities to increase sales and improve execution
* Regular communication to Director to include successes, failures, opportunities, monthly recaps
* Conduct monthly region meetings within team to communicate expectations, results, priorities
* Ensure sales materials are available and supplied, including samples, sell sheets, specifications, IRC's, etc
* Personnel management inclusive of hiring, firing, performance reviews
* Personnel training for best practices, use of software, expectations
* Manage team travel and expense budgets

  



Goals


* Works closely with Director, Retail Services for efficient and profitable deployment of company personnel and company assets against retail projects and retail expectations
* Establishes and maintains consistent retail practices and standard operating procedures within the assigned retail market.
* Fully deploys GoSpotCheck for Mission completion and comprehensive measurement of retail activity

  



What You Should Bring to the Table


* High school education or higher required
* Strong organization and multi-tasking skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft suites including Word, Excel and PowerPoint
* Ability to work in a team atmosphere as well as independently

  



Perks


* 16 days of PTO
* 11 paid company holidays per year
* 2 paid volunteer days per year
* 3 months fully paid parental leave (regardless of gender)
* Medical, dental, and vision
* Paid company life insurance
* 401k with company match
* Summer hours (half day Fridays from Memorial Day thru Labor Day)
* Work from home flexibility

  



Come As You Are



C.A. is committed to making our company more inclusive. Diversity fuels our innovation and better connects us to our clients, our colleagues, and our communities. Based on research, we know that women and other marginalized groups tend to apply to roles only when their experience perfectly matches the job description. That said, we encourage you to apply if you meet the majority of qualifications, especially if this role aligns with your career trajectory.

title: Sales Account Manager 2-Broadband
description:
Kontron is a global leader in IoT/Embedded Computing Technology (ECT). Kontron offers individual solutions in the areas of Internet of Things (IoT) and Industry 4.0 through a combined portfolio of hardware, software and services. With its standard and customized products based on highly reliable state-of-the-art technologies, Kontron provides secure and connected applications for a wide variety of industries. As a result, customers benefit from accelerated time-to-market, lower total cost of ownership, extended product lifecycles and the best fully integrated applications.


In addition to being an established global presence with opportunities for growth, Kontron encourages communication through all levels of the organization to ensure a common direction and allow our employees to make informed decisions. Our culture has been created by the people who work here, making Kontron a fast-paced, friendly, and enjoyable workplace with competitive salaries and excellent benefits.


We have an exciting opportunity for a mid-level role as **Sales Account Manager 2- Broadband** to join our Kontron Family! We are looking for a Sales Account Manager to join our sales team and help us grow our customer base in the US telecom industry. The Sales Account Manager Broadband will be responsible for identifying and pursuing new sales opportunities, building and maintaining relationships with existing and potential clients, and promoting our telecom products and services.


To be successful in this role, a candidate must have a strong sales background, excellent communication and negotiation skills, and a deep understanding of the telecom market and trends. The Sales Account Manager must also be able to work independently and collaboratively with other teams, such as marketing, engineering, and customer service.

* Develop and execute a sales strategy for the telecom industry, focusing on target segments, markets, and accounts
* Overall account management of Broadband Accounts in North America
* Research and generate leads, cold call, and email prospects
* Present and demonstrate our telecom products and services to potential clients, highlighting the features, benefits, and value proposition
* Identify and evaluate the current and potential needs and competitors of the target market
* Negotiate contracts and close deals with clients, ensuring mutual satisfaction and long-term partnership
* Meet and exceed sales quotas and objectives, and report on sales performance and progress
* Provide after-sales support and service to clients, resolving any issues or complaints, and ensuring customer retention and loyalty
* Attend industry events, trade shows, and conferences to network with potential clients and partners
* Stay updated on the latest telecom technologies, products, services, and competitors, and identify new opportunities and threats
* Proven relationship builder with exceptional organizational and communication skills to understand the customers business model, strategy, and requirements and to match them with Kontron's capabilities and objectives
* Grow the funnel for Broadband through Business Development initiatives
* Develop and maintain senior level relationships within key customers to broaden awareness, understand current and emerging needs, and position Kontron as a solution leader
* Review customer requests for quotations and specifications needed to determine the best fit product solution. Determine solution path to reach customer requirements.
* Prepare quotations to customers
* Provide general post-sales support by acting as the liaison between the customer and various departments within Kontron.
* Reporting of activity including keeping up to date CRM records as well as funnel reviews & forecasting
* Support of contract reviews.
* All other related tasks as assigned.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor Degree in Engineering, Business or equivalent field required
* Proven experience as a Business Development Manager, Sales Manager, or Account Manager in the telecom industry, with a track record of achieving sales goals and generating revenue
* Strong knowledge of telecom products and services, such as broadband, IP networking, etc. Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
* Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with clients and stakeholders
* Ability to work independently and in a team environment, and manage multiple tasks and projects
* Experience with Dynamics 365 preferred
* 3+ years’ experience in Broadband PON / GPON / XGSPON product sales, sales development, or product management
* Proven cross-functional leadership skills
* Data driven
* Excellent oral, written, presentation, spreadsheet, and communication skills.
* Ability to decipher ambiguous and conflicting information to set and drive account goals
* Proven ability to work under pressure in a high paced environment
* Ability to travel up to 30% domestically and internationally as needed


Looking for an honorable, professional, ethical, team player to work in a team environment who wants to be a contributor to the success of the organization.


Feel up to the challenge? Please apply

**Salary**


$145,000-$160,000 (OTE)

title: Frontline Marketing & Sales Enablement Manager
description:
**About the team**
------------------


Zillow is on a mission to rewire the real estate transaction! To enable that reality, we power an active network of partners across the country. Our Sales organization helps our partners grow the reach and impact of their businesses by connecting them to customers who seek to rent, buy or sell their homes. Sales plays a vital role, driving the acquisition, growth, and retention of partners but also influences the evolution of these partnerships as Zillow moves toward the next generation of our offerings. Sales’ success is our success, and we are committed to making their lives easier, better empowered, and more productive. The cross-functional Frontline Marketing team is chartered to deliver outstanding enablement through more relevant content, training, and tools to support product and program readiness of our frontline teams.**About the role**
------------------


We are seeking an experienced Marketing and Sales Enablement manager to support the step-level change in Sales Success efforts across our frontline teams! As a member of our team, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing the performance of Sales through the strategy, design, and successful execution of strong enablement programs that increase sales efficiency and drive revenue. This role brings new sales enablement ideas and strategies to up-level the Sales game we play today. You work directly with Sales and Operations to define, prioritize and drive sales effectiveness strategies aligned to business objectives. You are a “go-to” source for understanding the competition and market dynamics to strengthen our pitch of “why Zillow”, constantly targeting greater differentiation with our value proposition. You integrate Sales into the way the Business and Marketing think about frontline activation, delivering both To- and Through-Sales strategy and tactics. You thrive working cross-functionally—interfacing and collaborating with a wide variety of leaders across Marketing, Communications, Operations, Product, Training, and Sales and Service Teams. You are part of a Marketing team passionate about product and program enablement and readiness of our frontline teams.

**Core Responsibilities**
-------------------------

* You will be responsible for driving the end to end strategy of best-in-class enablement content and communications. This role will define program-level content and communications for the many operators across the customer and partner experience with Zillow. This role will help determine the best methods to deliver this “right message, right time” strategy.
* You build unique Sales activations as a part of our broader Marketing and brand efforts, driving relevant brand and marketing activations through frontline as a channel and translating campaigns into frontline tactics, content and collateral.
* Identify and support sales and revenue objectives through new Sales opportunities and effective enablement strategy.
* You support product launches in partnership with Product and Product Marketing by preparing and enabling the sales team to understand, pitch and sell through products and services.
* You work collaboratively across Sales, Operations, Training, Product, and Marketing to drive strategic alignment, effectiveness strategies, and new efficiencies across the organization.
* You are passionate about measurement and help to build foundational metrics for sales enablement to drive action plans for increased sales efficiency, adoption of enablement programs, and return on investment.
* You have a passion for insights, translating internal and market data into consumable assets for Sales.
* You influence the pursuit of and the continued investment in our Sales Enablement infrastructure to unlock scale, efficiency, and effectiveness. Your proactive knowledge of CRM and sales tools, technology, and industry standards will enable new unlocks for key sales capabilities.


This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $103,200.00 - $164,800.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.**Who you are**
---------------

* 6+ years mix of Consumer and Enterprise Marketing, Product Marketing, Sales and Service enablement experience or highly related revenue-driving experience
* A self starter with excellent problem solving and analytical skills
* Shown proficiency in collaboration, communication, and driving behavior change with Sales teams
* Experience crafting content from scratch, analyzing performance and actioning on next steps
* Proven project management skills and experience coordinating robust cross-functional teams to deliver phenomenal outcomes
* Experience in reporting, compiling requirements and use cases for business briefs
* Hands-on knowledge and expertise in extracting the most value from a Sales and Service tech stack: Salesforce, Highspot, Gong, Outreach, Salesloft, and related key enablement tools of the frontline.

**Get to know us**
------------------


Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.


As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.


Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

*Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.*

*Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.*

title: Sr. Support Offerings Sales Manager
description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.

**ABOUT SNOWFLAKE**



Snowflake started with a clear vision: develop a cloud data platform that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Snowflake developed an innovative new product with a built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. We are now a global, world-class organization with offices in more than a dozen countries and serving many more.


**ABOUT THE ROLE**



Snowflake Support is committed to providing high-quality resolutions to help deliver data-driven business insights and results. We are a team of subject matter experts collectively working toward our customers’ success. We form partnerships with customers by listening, learning, and building connections.



Snowflake’s values are key to our approach and success in delivering world-class Support. Putting customers first, owning initiative and accountability, and getting it done are Snowflake core values and are reflected in everything we do.



Snowflake’s Support team is expanding! We are looking for a Sales Enablement Professional to join our team.


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


**SALE ENABLEMENT:**


* Develop and deliver training content for sales teams to ensure a deep understanding of Snowflake Support offerings.
* Provide sales teams with tools and resources that facilitate their sales efforts, including demos, case studies, and competitive intelligence.
* Collaborate closely with Support Product Marketing to ensure alignment between sales and marketing efforts.
* Work with Product Marketing and other stakeholders to create and maintain sales collateral, presentations, sales tooling, and sales scripts that articulate the value of Snowflake Support offerings to potential customers.
* Manage our sales enablement assets to provide the sales team with access to the latest content, training, and resources, in collaboration with the Sales Enablement team.

**SALE OPERATIONS:**


* Streamline Snowflake Support sales processes, making sales cycles more effective, efficient, and customer-centric.
* Implement tracking mechanisms to monitor the performance of sales efforts, identify opportunities for improvement, and identify/refine target customer profiles.
* Continuously monitor the competitive landscape to identify strengths and opportunities for improvement of Snowflake Support offerings and adjust sales strategies accordingly.
* Create retention strategies for customers approaching renewal as well as perform customer interviews to understand the outcomes of renewals

**CROSS-FUNCTIONAL COLLABORATION:**


* Build and maintain close relationships with Product Sales and Professional Services teams to build a continual pipeline of leads and opportunities for Support Offerings globally.
* Establish feedback loops between Sales teams and Support Product Management to integrate customer feedback into Offering improvements and marketing strategies.
* Communicate pipeline activity to the Delivery teams ensuring visibility as to upcoming resource needs.
* Work closely with sales communications, sales leadership, and sales enablement teams to meet goals.
* Assist in pitching Snowflake Support offerings as needed.
* Create positive relationships, rapport, and reputation in the sales organization.

**REQUIREMENTS:**


* 8+ years of experience in SaaS or cloud computing, specifically within professional services, support, or sales.
* Knowledge of data warehousing, data management, analytics, or cloud computing space.
* Experience selling B2B services and managing sales targets.
* Comfortable using Salesforce, ServiceNow, or other leading CRM tools.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Strong consultative skills and ability to conduct discovery and create solutions to problems.
* Ability to manage competing priorities across multiple projects while meeting deadlines.
* Willingness to travel as needed and potentially support other regions.


The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role:

* The estimated base salary range for this role is $147,000 - $224,250.
* Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake’s bonus and equity plan.


The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending & health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits.


Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.


How do you want to make your impact?

title: Senior IT Capture Manager
description:
Capture Manager

**Job Summary**

The Capture Manager plays a crucial role in OPTiMO’s business development efforts by leading the capture process for potential contracts. This role involves strategic planning, communication, and collaboration with various internal and external stakeholders to position OPTiMO favorably and secure new business opportunities.

**Responsibilities**

· **Point of Contact and Communication:** Act as the primary point of contact and effective communicator between OPTiMO, Contracting Officer (CO), Prime Contractors, and Subcontractors throughout the capture process.

· **Competitive Intelligence:** Lead the gathering and assessment of competitive intelligence to develop a comprehensive understanding of the competitive landscape, market trends, and potential opportunities. Utilize this information to refine OPTiMO's capture strategy.

· **Customer Call Plan:** Develop and execute a customer call plan to engage with key decision-makers and influencers within potential customer organizations. Gather insights, address concerns, and position OPTiMO's capabilities effectively.

· **Teaming Strategy:** Lead the development of a teaming strategy, if required, to address capability, staffing, and past performance gaps. Identify and evaluate potential partners, subcontractors, or collaborators to strengthen OPTiMO's bid and proposal.

· **Scope and Workshare Coordination:** Collaborate with internal stakeholders to coordinate discussions on scope and workshare arrangements to optimize OPTiMO's position within the Statement of Work (SOW).

· **Proposal Development Support:** Work closely with the proposal team to ensure that the capture strategy is seamlessly integrated into the proposal. Provide critical insights, data, and information to enhance the proposal's competitiveness.

· **Risk Assessment:** Identify and assess potential risks associated with the capture effort and propose mitigation strategies to address those risks effectively.

· **Market Analysis:** Continuously monitor market trends, industry developments, and customer needs to adapt the capture strategy as necessary and stay ahead of the competition.

· **Relationship Building:** Articulate OPTiMO’s value proposition and cultivate and maintain strong relationships with potential customers, partners, and subcontractors to foster collaboration and support OPTiMO's growth objectives.

**Requirements**

**Education / Experience**

· Bachelor's in business, Marketing, Engineering, or a related discipline

· This is a Senior level role, requiring at least 8 or more years of experience in capture management, business development, or related roles, preferably within the government contracting sector.

**Required KSA (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):**

· **Knowledge:** In-depth understanding of the federal contracting landscape, competitive intelligence gathering, and capture management best practices. Familiarity with government acquisition processes, regulations, and customer dynamics.

· **Skills:** Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, strategic thinking, negotiation abilities, project management, and the capability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams. Demonstrated ability to identify, develop, and promote opportunities through our pipeline phases, with measurable increases in probability of winning leading up to proposal submittal. Well-organized, goal-oriented proven achiever.

· **Abilities:** Ability to analyze complex information, make informed decisions under pressure, build and manage relationships, adapt to changing circumstances, and lead teams effectively. Ability to present and participate in Executive-level meetings.

**Preferred KSA (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):**

· Experience in **technical** solutions business development.

· Federal business development experience; small business and 8(a) experience a plus.

· Experience managing proposals from the prime and subcontractor positions.

**Success Criteria**

· Proactive, outside-of-the-box thinkers; inquisitive strategists who have an ability to problem solve and “find a way” around obstacles

· Demonstrated capture phase competencies and experience in teaming, solution development, customer call plan execution, staffing planning, and pricing strategy

· Successfully win contracts through a well-executed capture process.

· Effective communication and coordination between internal and external stakeholders.

· Timely and accurate delivery of competitive intelligence and customer insights.

· Development of a robust teaming strategy that addresses capability gaps.

· Alignment of capture strategy with proposal efforts, resulting in high-quality submissions.

· Positive feedback from customers, partners, and team members on collaboration and leadership.

· Consistent monitoring and adaptation of capture strategies based on market trends.

· Mitigation of risks through proactive identification and planning.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* How many years of experience do you have in managing proposals from the prime and subcontractor positions ?
* Do you have federal business development experience, specifically small business and 8(a) experience?
* How many years of experience do you have in technical solutions business development ?
* How many years of experience do you have with the government acquisition processes ?
* How many years of experience do you have with federal contracting landscape, competitive intelligence gathering, and capture management best practices ?

Work Location: Remote

title: Sales Manager - TMC Americas
description:
AMETEK TMC combines state-of-the-art floor vibration cancellation technology with a commitment to manufacturing. Our products are manufactured in our world-class, 80,000 square foot, vertically integrated, manufacturing facility and headquarters in Peabody, Massachusetts on Route 128, “America’s Technology Highway.” To manufacture most of our products we literally start with sheets of steel coming in our loading dock where they are laser cut, bent, welded, drilled, ground, sanded, polished, painted, assembled into final products and shipped to customers on all seven continents.
**TMC Americas Sales Manager –** The TMC Americas Sales Manager has responsibilities for overall TMC business in the Americas (both North America and South America) and is responsible for ensuring annual business goals are met. The TMC Americas Sales Manager will build business strategies and execute the action plans to achieve annual orders & sales target, and achieve new business development target, and achieve other performance goals and objectives.  

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**
* Lead, Manage, and Coach TMC Americas Sales Team to achieve orders & sales target and drive year-over-year growth.
* Lead, Manage, and Coach TMC Americas Sales Team to develop new businesses and drive year-over-year growth.
* Lead, Manage, and Coach TMC Americas Sales team to develop and manage key accounts, obtain single source and major market share position, and drive year-over-year growth.
* Report voice of customers to management team. Highlight the requirements of local market needs to grow TMC business.
* Lead, Manage, and Coach TMC Americas Sales Team to use CRM tools to manage an active opportunity pipeline with accurate and detailed information with weekly updates.
* Responsible to provide sales forecast in a weekly basis and when required.
* Responsible to provide weekly reports and when required.
* Responsible for business presentations at customers meetings, trade shows, seminars, conferences, internal meetings, and when required.
* Provide market research, pricing analysis, competitive analysis regularly and when required
* Support pricing strategies especially price increases and achieve the business goals while managing customers expectations and relationships with minimum disruptions.
* Ensure NDA, quotation, contract, purchase order, order acknowledgement, purchase agreement, suppliers agreement, technical agreement, tender agreement, business transaction, rep agreement, distributors agreement met all AMETEK business compliance requirements, regulatory standards, AMETEK policy, Terms and Conditions of Sale, US laws and regulations.
* Work with all AMETEK colleagues to collaborate and win business for TMC

  


**REQUIREMENTS FOR** **CONSIDERATION**  


* Undergraduate degree in engineering or other technical degree is required
* Minimum 10 years of experience in sales in a technology oriented organization is required
* Experiences with Semiconductor, Electron Microscopy, Life Science, Photonics, Vibration Control is required
* Sales experience of capital equipment is required
* A proven record of growing the business as a technical sales team leader is required
* Experiences with market research, pricing, marketing communications, competitive analysis is required
* Highly organized, effective time management, prioritization and follow-up skills is required
* Experience with Salesforce is required
* A deal closer is a must!
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
* Excellent presentations skills in English
* Position demands extensive travel in the Americas, oversea travel is required when necessarily

title: Sales Manager
description:
Are you looking for a job with freedom and flexibility with amazing earning potential? We’re hiring a dynamic sales manager to lead our team to success. You’ll be responsible for setting the sales strategies and objectives, identifying sales targets, and evaluating the team’s sales performance to help us achieve our sales goals. If you’re a natural leader who loves exciting challenges with financial incentives, we want to hear from you!**Responsibilities:*** Lead our sales team by setting a sales plan for each sales representative, identifying individual sales targets, assigning sales territories, and overseeing training programs to make sure they’re successful
* Outline our sales strategies and objectives to ensure we make our sales goals
* Build and foster strong customer relationships and handle complaints to ensure their needs are met and keep their business

**Qualifications:*** Exemplary communication skills, leadership skills, and analytical skills

* Demonstrates a proven track record of success in sales

**About Company**  

GK Realty Group is a leading real estate firm based in Fort Lauderdale, committed to providing exceptional service and expertise to our clients. With a focus on integrity, professionalism, and innovation, we have established ourselves as a trusted partner in the real estate industry.

title: Sales Manager
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Life Insurance Sales Representative to join our team. As a Life Insurance Sales Representative, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining strong connections with life insurers, while leveraging your expertise in the industry to drive sales and meet revenue targets. Your ability to connect with C-level executives and build relationships will be crucial in expanding our client base

  

Requirements:  

  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Establish and nurture strong connections with life insurers: Utilize your extensive network and industry knowledge to build and maintain relationships with key decision-makers in the life insurance sector. Leverage these connections to promote our products and services effectively.
* Connect with C-level executives: Engage with senior-level executives within life insurance companies, such as CEOs, CFOs, and CIOs. Understand their needs and demonstrate how our solutions can add value to their organizations.
* Individual contributor role: As an individual contributor, you will have the autonomy to drive your sales efforts independently. You will be responsible for generating leads, conducting sales presentations, and closing deals.
* Utilize analytics background: Leverage your analytical skills and background to identify opportunities, analyze market trends, and create data-driven strategies to optimize sales performance.
* Experience in small/medium companies: Your experience working in small to medium-sized companies will be valuable in understanding the unique challenges and dynamics of these organizations. Adapt your sales approach accordingly to effectively address their specific needs.
* Minimum 3 years experience in life insurance system sales: Demonstrate a solid track record of success in selling life insurance systems, with a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience. Your in-depth understanding of the life insurance industry and its systems will enable you to articulate the benefits of our solutions convincingly.
* Location preference: Ideally, you should reside west of the Mississippi. This is to ensure convenient access to clients and prospects within your territory.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience and success in life insurance system sales, with a minimum of 3 years' experience.
* Strong connections and network within the life insurance industry.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to connect with C-level executives.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to leverage data in sales strategies.
* Self-motivated and goal-oriented individual.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team when required.
* Flexibility to adapt to the unique requirements of small/medium-sized companies.
* Residence west of the Mississippi.

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
**Remote Regional Sales Manager Opportunity - Competitive Compensation/Bonuses/Residual Earnings**


Are you eager to:

* Establish something for yourself rather than contribute only to someone else's business
* Operate from any location - virtually
* Connect with authentic, interested prospects, eliminating the need for cold calling
* Design your own timetable to accommodate your bustling lifestyle
* Receive fair compensation reflecting your value and earn increments through your dedication

* Aspire to be part of an exciting journey alongside like-minded individuals

$120,000 yearly + Bonuses

**Responsibilities:*** We're generating 15,000-20,000 new leads per WEEK and we need qualified individuals to help service these families. Help as many as you want in any given week!

We pride ourselves on embracing cutting-edge technology-driven solutions to assist our sales teams in providing a best-in-class customer experience. We're a leadership developmental company that happens to work in the financial services field.

title: Sales Account Manager
description:
< Back  
**Work From Home**

*Work in your slippers. Full or part-time, no-cap commission!*

Do you enjoy talking to small and medium-sized businesses, about their business? We have interesting and fun project-based work for our media partners across the USA. We have multiple positions open in all US Time Zones.

**The Warmest Call You Can Make**

* This is spending time, informing businesses about our media partners' local Best Of program.
* This is not hard selling ... this is helping people win the love and affection of their fan base!
* Flexible schedules and we have projects based in Pacific, Mountain, Central & Eastern time zones.
* We pay a generous commission.
* You must be comfortable working through gatekeepers and using email as a point of contact. All of our assignments have robust marketing sites and Amazon-style carts.

You must have high speed internet.
